intro: Drymonia sulphurea, commonly known as the golden bracted heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, bracted inflorescences. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in open woodlands or pine savannas. Drymonia sulphurea is a low-growing shrub that produces small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture.
